title: Adani not ready to budge on original tariff rate for Mannar wind project
byline: India’s Adani Group is not ready to compromise on the initially agreed tariff rate and other parameters of the 484 MW wind and transmission project in Mannar, despite its agreement to execute the project if Sri Lanka requests, Daily Mirror learns.

title: Bangladesh court orders seizure of cricketer Shakib’s assets
byline: A Bangladeshi court ordered the seizure of cricketer Shakib Al Hasan’s assets in the latest legal headache for the sports star over his allegiance to the country’s former leader.

title: Ten Bangladeshi migrants arrested in Katunayake
byline: A group of 10 Bangladeshi nationals who had entered the country illegally with the intention of fleeing to Europe were arrested by officers of the Investigation Division of the Immigration and Emigration Department in the Adiambalam area of ​​Katunayake yesterday.

title: Rising bets for Central Bank to stay pat on current rates at upcoming policy meeting
byline: The Central Bank is set to keep the rates when it meets for the second time for this year, this week, to decide on the key policy rate, after it left the overnight policy rate (OPR) unchanged at its January meeting.

title: Transshipment decline at Port of Colombo extends to second straight month in February
byline: The transshipment volumes at the Port of Colombo declined for the second straight month in February, as the services that earlier pulled out of Colombo, amidst heavy congestion, were yet to return to the port.

title: Massive 6.8 magnitude earthquake hits New Zealand
byline: A massive 6.8 magnitude earthquake has hit New Zealand’s Riverton coast on Tuesday. The United States Geological Survey (USGS) first reported the magnitude to be 7, but later revised it to 6.8. The quake struck off the coast of Riverton in New Zealand on Tuesday.

title: Palestinian Oscar winner held by Israeli soldiers
byline: A Palestinian Oscar winner has been detained in the occupied West Bank following an outbreak of violence between Israeli settlers and Palestinians, activists say.

title: Exports hit US $ 1.38bn in February
byline: Sri Lanka’s export sector continued its growth momentum in February 2025, with total exports reaching US $ 1.38 billion, reflecting a 4.62 percent year-on-year (YoY) increase, data from the Export Development Board showed.

title: UK imposes sanctions on four individuals including Shavendra Silva over human rights violations
byline: The UK government has imposed sanctions on four individuals responsible for serious human rights abuses and violations during the Sri Lanka civil war, including extrajudicial killings, torture and/or perpetration of sexual violence.

title: NPP hands over motion to remove Deshabandu Tennakoon
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has handed over a motion to the Speaker seeking the removal of suspended IGP Deshabandu Tennakoon.

title: Royal Madras Yacht Club to launch first Chennai-Sri Lanka sailing expedition
byline: The Royal Madras Yacht Club is set to launch the first international sailing expedition from Chennai to Sri Lanka, lasting seven days.

title: Namal questions Govt on UK sanctions against ex-military commanders
byline: In the wake of recent sanctions imposed by the UK government on four individuals, including Shavendra Silva and Wasantha Karannagoda, SLPP MP Namal Rajapaksa questioned whether the new government, led by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, will defend the former military commanders when foreign powers target them.

title: Supreme Court to hear Katchatheevu case on September 15
byline: The Supreme Court on Tuesday (March 25, 2025) allowed DMK leader T.R. Baalu to replace former Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M. Karunanidhi, who passed away in 2018, as petitioner in over a decade-old challenge against agreements entered into between India and Sri Lanka to “cede” Katchatheevu to the island nation.

title: Chamara Silva appointed as Sri Lanka U19 Head Coach
byline: Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) appointed Chamara Silva as the Head Coach of the Sri Lanka U19 National Team.

title: White House mistakenly shares Yemen war plans with a journalist
byline: Top Trump administration officials mistakenly disclosed war plans in a messaging group that included a journalist shortly before the U.S. attacked Yemen’s Iran-aligned Houthis, the White House said on Monday, following a first-hand account by The Atlantic.

title: SJB to support Deshabandu’s removal
byline: The main Opposition Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) will support the motion brought in by the government to remove IGP Deshabandu Tennakoon from office, MP Ajith P. Perera said today.

title: Millions of UK tyres meant for recycling sent to furnaces in India
byline: Millions of tyres being sent from the UK to India for recycling are actually being ’’cooked’’ in makeshift furnaces causing serious health problems and huge environmental damage, the BBC has discovered.

title: No tax revisions on vehicle imports this year: Duminda Hulangamuwa
byline: According to the International Monetary Fund (IMF) agreement, vehicle taxes cannot be reduced, and there will be no tax revisions on vehicle imports this year, Senior Economic Advisor to the President Duminda Hulangamuwa said.

title: Deputy Minister refutes declaring open toilet
byline: Deputy Minister of Housing T.B. Sarath refuted media reports that he had declared open a toilet.

title: 'Record' payout for world’s longest-serving death row inmate
byline: Japan has awarded a wrongly convicted man who was on death row for close to half a century compensation of 217 million yen ($1.44m).

title: Harsha questions Hulangamuwa
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Harsha de Silva today questioned the remark made by Presidential Adviser Duminda Hulangamuwa who had said there has been no conflict of Interest in getting E&Y and him being an adviser to the government.

title: Immigration seizes largest ever group of locals bound for Canada with forged visas
byline: Nine Sri Lankans who attempted to leave for Canada through a major human smuggling scam that charged Rs. 4.5 million each to fix a forged visa, were halted by the immigration officials at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) last evening (24), making it the largest group ever seized migrating to a foreign country with bogus travel papers.

title: European car sales dip in February
byline: A sharp decline in overall sales in major markets including Germany and Italy dragged down the numbers of newly registered cars in the EU.

title: Severe lightning advisory for 12 districts
byline: An advisory for severe lightning was issued today for the Western, Sabaragamuwa, Southern and Uva Provinces, as well as the Ampara and Nuwara Eliya districts, the Natural Hazards Early Warning Centre of the Meteorology Department announced.

title: Match-fixing allegations: Indian cricket manager jailed for 4 years
byline: An Indian cricket manager found guilty of match-fixing allegations related to the Legend Cricket League 2024 was today sentenced to four years of imprisonment by the Matale High Court.

title: Circular issued on public sector salary revisions
byline: The government has issued a circular regarding the revision of salaries for public sector employees.

title: SL should work with Adani, other investors to achieve economic growth: Ranil
byline: Sri Lanka should work with the Adani group and other investors if is to experience an economic recovery and growth, former President Ranil Wickremesinghe said today.

title: TRCSL dismisses claims of ‘Starlink’ suspension
byline: The Telecommunications Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka (TRCSL) has denied reports suggesting that the planned rollout of the ‘Starlink’ satellite broadband service in the country has been suspended.
